comment.description: change to product_definition_relationship; Jurgita needs to update xml and descriptions

issue.description: Equivalent_functional_unit_definition_assignment was added to express in this module. The descriptions and xml need to be updated. The descriptions are in the network_functional_design_view arm. There is an open issue in network functional design view until the descriptions have been migrated.
The rule queries Network_function_version, but it should query Product_version.
The INVERSE attribute tries to enforce existence rules over items that it can't control.

comment.description: removed attribute. Jurgita to update arm.xml and descriptions.

issue.description: The INVERSE attribute tries to enforce existence rules over items that it can't control.

comment.description: removed attribute. Jurgita to update arm.xml and descriptions.

issue.description: The rule is obsolete once the attributes are removed.

comment.description: removed rule. Jurgita to update arm.xml and descriptions.

issue.description: The scope should be revised to remove network_functional_design_view. The inscope item is in conflict with the stated out of scope item. The scope should be revised to remove the statement "the useage of a functional unit" and replace with the 'interface to a functional unit'.

comment.description: Removal of this USE FROMS affected functional_specification module. Changed use from Functional_usage_view to Network_functional_design_view.

issue.description: The subtyping of Product function into network and non network is invalid. There is no need for anything other than a Functionality subtype of Product for all functional views. rename the AO Functionality or remove it if Functionality already exists.

The subtyping of Product_version function into network and non network is invalid. There is no need for anything other than a Functionality_version subtype of Product_version for all functional views. rename the AO Functionality_version or remove it if Functionality_version already exists.
